fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of 2018 anti-Brexit march mislabelled as showing 2021 anti-lockdown march
fact_check_explanation_summary: An aerial image is claimed to be from the 24 April anti-lockdown march in London. It was actually from a 2018 march against Brexit.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 child vaccine trial paused over clot concerns, not cot death
fact_check_explanation_summary: The study was giving the Covid-19 vaccine to children aged between six and 17, not infants.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mike Yeadon wrong again on lockdowns and face masks
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that lockdowns and face masks don’t work are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s more to the claim only 32 vaccinated people were hospitalised with Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A report in the Telegraph claimed there was only one vaccinated case per 2,300 patients. That’s highly misleading.

fact_check_explanation_title: Error-strewn paper claims face masks are ineffective and harmful
fact_check_explanation_summary: The ‘peer-reviewed paper from Stanford’ is not from Stanford and may not have been conventionally peer-reviewed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Being near to people vaccinated against Covid-19 won’t give you side effects
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is nothing in the Covid-19 vaccines used in the UK that could cause vaccine shedding.

fact_check_explanation_title: Here’s what you should know about the Lobbying Act
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Greensill story has brought the legislation back under public scrutiny, but disagreements over it are nothing new.

fact_check_explanation_title: Godfrey Bloom video makes false claims about vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Former MEP Godfrey Bloom has made a number of false claims about Covid-19 vaccines

fact_check_explanation_title: Results of Covid-19 vaccine trials have been published and peer-reviewed
fact_check_explanation_summary: The studies have a future completion date to allow long term follow up of participants. That doesn’t mean that the data we have so far is invalid.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know if the ‘Nigerian variant’ is more deadly
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although current data demonstrates a higher mortality rate for this Covid-19 variant, this is based on small numbers.
Some social media users have fabricated quotes about the super league attributed to Klopp and Ferguson. We spoke to one of them.
Ivermectin has been publicised as a potential wonder drug for Covid-19. Research so far has been promising, but is not deemed conclusive by regulators.
